def_en: If you give someone or something your attention, you look at it, listen to it, or think about it carefully.

def_cn: （尤指大众的）注意力，关注
def_en: Attention is great interest that is shown in someone or something, particularly by the general public.
If someone or something is getting attention, they are being dealt with or cared for.

def_cn: （尤指令人讨厌的）关注，殷勤
def_en: You can refer to someone's efforts to help you, or the interest they show in you, as their attentions, especially if you dislike or disapprove of them.
If you bring something to someone's attention or draw their attention to it, you tell them about it or make them notice it.
If someone or something attracts your attention or catches your attention, you suddenly notice them.

def_cn: 关心/不关心；注意/不注意
def_en: If you pay attention to someone, you watch them, listen to them, or take notice of them. If you pay no attention to someone, you behave as if you are not aware of them or as if they are not important.
When people stand to attention or stand at attention, they stand straight with their feet together and their arms at their sides.
